page.title: 10LIFE ON A TURKEY FARM (2)
page.content: put). When he is in the feather room he walks into the herding pen and picks up a piece of wood with a hook on the end and catches a turkey with it. Then he takes the turkey into the killing room and kills it. When it is dead he takes it into the feather room and plucks off its feathers. When it is plucked he does that to the rest of the turkeys. When the turkeys are all plucked he puts them into the freezer. The person plucks 50 turkeys in the morning and 75 turkeys in the afternoon. When he is finished he gets cleaned up and goes home. After they are plucked, someone comes round collecting the feathers. They are then taken behind the sheds and petrol is put all over them and they are burned. The turkeys are sold mostly at Christmas and Easter.
